title: Web Accessibility Auditing
headline: Learn the fundamental skills on auditing web accessible content and interfaces with this free online course.
description: The global standards governing web accessibility are the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) and this free online course gives a detailed overview of how to audit content to determine its accessibility for people with disabilities. This free Web Accessibility Auditing course will also teach you the various pitfalls in web content and interface auditing and what is involved in testing web applications for accessibility.
courseDescription:
Modern day web content, design and development is continually changing with new technologies and formats being created but for people with disabilities, these are often inaccessible. In this free online Web Accessibility Auditing UX UI course, you will learn the fundamentals of web accessibility, its role in modern day web design and development, the international Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) as well as the technologies involved. 

Once these basics are covered, the focus of this web accessibility course then shifts to the actual auditing process which includes how to test and ensure web pages are accessible, how to audit web components and what is involved in auditing web applications. This course will also teach you in detail the various kinds of tests you can do such as automated and manual testing strategies as well as user testing.

Web accessibility aims to break down the technological barriers for people with disabilities and if you want to learn the basics of the web accessibility guidelines and refine your skills to include auditing and testing to ensure accessibility, then register today.
